Function reference version 1.1.0.9000

Pattern matching

Control matching behaviour with modifier functions.

  • modifiers
  • fixed
  • coll
  • regex
  • boundary

Count the number of matches in a string.

  • str_count

Detect the presence or absence of a pattern in a string.

  • str_detect

Extract matching patterns from a string.

  • str_extract
  • str_extract_all

Locate the position of patterns in a string.

  • str_locate
  • str_locate_all

Extract matched groups from a string.

  • str_match
  • str_match_all

Replace matched patterns in a string.

  • str_replace
  • str_replace_all

Split up a string into pieces.

  • str_split
  • str_split_fixed

Keep strings matching a pattern.

  • str_subset

View HTML rendering of regular expression match.

  • str_view
  • str_view_all

Whitespace

Pad a string.

  • str_pad

Trim whitespace from start and end of string.

  • str_trim

Wrap strings into nicely formatted paragraphs.

  • str_wrap

Locale senstive

Convert case of a string.

  • case
  • str_to_upper
  • str_to_lower
  • str_to_title

Order or sort a character vector.

  • str_order
  • str_sort

Other helpers

Switch location of matches to location of non-matches.

  • invert_match

Join multiple strings into a single string.

  • str_c
  • str_join

Specify the encoding of a string.

  • str_conv

Duplicate and concatenate strings within a character vector.

  • str_dup

String interpolation.

  • str_interp

The length of a string.

  • str_length

Turn NA into "NA"

  • str_replace_na

Extract and replace substrings from a character vector.

  • str_sub
  • str_sub<-

Truncate a character string.

  • str_trunc

Extract words from a sentence.

  • word
